summary: Concept Delta - An MHT-CET practice test platform with a navy/light blue color scheme, featuring routes for home, dashboard, admin, about, test, and result pages. Initial focus on layout structure, navbar with logo, footer, and hero section.
architectural_notes: Navy (#1e3a8a) and light blue (#60a5fa) color scheme with white backgrounds
Gradient button component transitioning from navy to light blue
Route structure: home, dashboard, admin, about, test/:id, result/:id
AuthContext pattern for global auth state management
Protected routes with redirect logic for unauthenticated users
Role-based access control with 'student' and 'admin' roles via AuthContext
Role assignment uses exact string comparison: principal.toText() === ADMIN_PRINCIPAL

existing_features.title: Create routing structure with six pages: Home (/), Dashboard (/dashboard), Admin (/admin), About (/about), Test with dynamic ID parameter (/test/:id), and Result with dynamic ID parameter (/result/:id). All pages should be empty placeholders initially.

Implement a responsive Navbar component with left side containing the Delta logo (from uploaded photo_2026-02-19_19-46-20.jpg processed as a transparent, optimized header image) and 'Concept Delta' text, right side containing navigation links for Home, About, and Login (placeholder), and a mobile hamburger menu that reveals navigation links on smaller screens.

Establish the branding color scheme using Primary Navy (#1e3a8a) and Light Blue Accent (#60a5fa) with white background sections throughout the application. Create a reusable gradient button component that transitions from navy to light blue.
Create a Footer component containing 'Concept Delta © 2026' copyright text, 'COEPian Initiative' text, and placeholder links/icons for YouTube and Telegram social channels.

Design and implement a Hero Section for the Home page with a big heading stating 'practice MHT-CET with real exam level mock tests', subtext reading 'Free practice tests designed by COEPians', and a prominent CTA button labeled 'Start Free Test' using the gradient button component. Keep the design minimal and uncluttered.

Create an AuthContext that manages authentication state with isAuthenticated boolean, principalId string, login() function to trigger Internet Identity popup authentication, and logout() function to clear session
Modify Navbar component to display Login button when user is not authenticated and Logout button when authenticated, with shortened principal ID displayed next to Logout button
Implement authentication persistence that checks for existing authenticated session on page load and automatically restores the session if valid
Protect the /dashboard route by redirecting unauthenticated users to the home page (/)
Extend AuthContext to include a role state property with type 'student' | 'admin', and define a constant ADMIN_PRINCIPAL with value 'REPLACE_WITH_MY_PRINCIPAL'
Implement role assignment logic that sets role to 'admin' if principalId matches ADMIN_PRINCIPAL, otherwise sets role to 'student', executed after successful login
Update Navbar component to conditionally display an 'Admin' navigation link only when the user's role is 'admin', hiding it for 'student' role users
Add a visible text element to the Navbar component that displays the full principal ID when a user is authenticated, positioned near the logout button
Update the ADMIN_PRINCIPAL constant in AuthContext to 'jqvc4-5tjdu-a3br6-pm2i3-cgbcq-umfiv-r2kcw-z4hju-ox52z-apmjw-eqe'
Modify the role assignment logic in AuthContext to use principal.toText() for comparison: if (principal.toText() === ADMIN_PRINCIPAL) { setRole('admin'); } else { setRole('student'); }
Add console logging in AuthContext after role assignment that logs both the principal ID using principal.toText() and the assigned role value
Implement route protection in the Admin page component that redirects unauthenticated users to the home page (/) using React Router's useNavigate hook and useEffect
Implement role-based access control in the Admin page component that redirects users with role !== 'admin' to the dashboard page (/dashboard) using React Router's useNavigate hook and useEffect
Consume isAuthenticated and role values from AuthContext using useAuth hook in the Admin page component to enable the protection logic

new_feature_requests.summary: Layout structure with navbar, main content area, and footer
Navbar with Delta logo, 'Concept Delta' text, Home/About/Login links, and mobile hamburger menu
Branding: Navy (#1e3a8a) and light blue (#60a5fa) colors, gradient button component
Footer with 'Concept Delta © 2026', COEPian Initiative text, and YouTube/Telegram placeholders
Hero section with MHT-CET heading, subtext, and 'Start Free Test' CTA button
AuthContext managing isAuthenticated, principalId, login(), logout()
Login/Logout button in Navbar with principal ID display (shortened)
Persist authentication across page refresh with automatic session restore
Protect /dashboard route - redirect to / if not authenticated
Install and configure @dfinity/auth-client package for Internet Identity integration
Protect /admin route - redirect unauthenticated users to / and non-admin users to /dashboard
